titleStmt.title: A testimony of truth with an exhortation of love unto such as are convinced by Gods light ... which is able to save their souls ... that so the adversary of their souls everlasting welfare may never prevail against any ... and they fall short of the race and of the purchased possession prepared for all them that in faithfulness perservere until the end / [by] Hen. Jackson, younger.
titleStmt.author: Jackson, Henry, fl. 1662-1700.

titleStmt.title: A testimony of truth with an exhortation of love unto such as are convinced by Gods light ... which is able to save their souls ... that so the adversary of their souls everlasting welfare may never prevail against any ... and they fall short of the race and of the purchased possession prepared for all them that in faithfulness perservere until the end / [by] Hen. Jackson, younger.
titleStmt.author: Jackson, Henry, fl. 1662-1700.

notesStmt.note: Dated at end : From the Lodge in Essex this 4th day of the 9th month 1662.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
